page.title: 16Local Concern,Environment
page.content: People locally are disturbed by the losses of trees and hedgerows, ponds that have been filled in and loss of wildlife habitats.The hedgerows that remain are cropped short and narrow every year (often after harvest) damaged by straw burning and cut by mechanical hedge cutters which prevent growth of hedgerow saplings which may have replaced dying trees.Although some efforts have been made at protecting and replacing trees, no new hedges have been planted which would prevent soil erosion, snow drifts on roads, add beauty and variety to the landscape and provide vital wildlife habitats.Footpaths often followed hedgerows and today when the hedge has gone, the path is ploughed and walkers no longer welcome to use it.
